III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(iii)Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or otherwise
suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a
youth’s background or appearance or mental state. Yelling,
threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Type Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Allegation Former Staff 1 referred to Youth J in a derogatory manner
and threatened to put hands on her.
Investigation I contacted Complainant, also Staff 3, via phone on 5/2/23. She
denied witnessing the interaction between Youth J and Former
Staff 1 but identified Staff 2 as a witness.
I notified Rights Officer of the allegations.
I reviewed the facility’s history of licensing rule violations.
I notified Foster Care Worker that I was assigned this
investigation. She expressed no concerns about staff at the
facility.
I interviewed Youth J with Rights Officer present on 5/4/23.
She said she was standing around the staff desk having a “bad
hair day.” Former Staff 1 asked if she was going to school or
not and “checked” her (meaning the staff confronted her about
saying one thing and doing another.) We argued about it. Staff
2 was there. Former Staff 1 told Staff 2, ‘If this mother fucker
comes close to me, I’m going to knock her ass out.’”
I interviewed Youth A with Rights Officer present. Prior to
interacting with Youth J, she said Former Staff 1 “had an
attitude.” She was “checking” Youth J challenging whether or
not she was going to school. Youth A heard Former Staff 1
say, “Let this little mother fucker walk up on me. I’ll beat the
fuck out of her.”
2

I interviewed Youth P with Rights Officer present. She said
Youth J got loud on the unit and said, “This hoe better not come
near me.” Youth P did not hear Former Staff 1 say anything
inappropriate back.
I interviewed Staff 2 with Rights Officer present. She has
worked at the facility for seven months. Staff 2 was present
when Youth J announced she would stay in her room all day
and miss school. After that Youth J came out of her room
asking for the blow dryer. Former Staff 1 said to Youth J, “I
thought you weren’t going to school.” Youth J said she might
go and started cussing. Former Staff 1 remarked, “These kids
are not going to keep disrespecting me.” Staff 2 denied hearing
Former Staff 1 cuss or threaten Youth J.
I was unable to interview Former Staff 1 as she resigned and
never returned to work after this incident. Rights Officer,
however, said he did speak to Former Staff 1 on the day of the
incident, and she denied all of the allegations. Rights Officer
added that Youth A and J are “very close” and that he suspects
they may have collaborated to provide an inaccurate account of
events.
Analysis Youth J and A supported the allegations while Staff 2, Youth P
and Former Staff 1 denied them. At this time, it cannot be
determined that Former Staff 1 spoke in a derogatory manner
or threatened to harm Youth J.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
